title: Air-Fried Sweet Potato Fries
full_text:
Air-Fried Sweet Potato Fries
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Cook
28 mins
Total
0 mins
Total
38 mins
Serves
2 Servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
2
tablespoons
oil
2
teaspoons
cornstarch
2
teaspoons
white rice flour,
such as Bob’s Red Mill
1/2
teaspoon
granulated sugar
1
teaspoon
kosher salt,
divided; for table salt, use half as much by volume
1
large
sweet potato
(about 1 pound; 425g), peeled and cut into 1/4-inch thick fries
Nonstick
cooking spray
Directions
Preheat a 6-quart air fryer to 385°F (196ºC) for 5 minutes. In a medium bowl, whisk together oil, cornstarch, rice flour, sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt until a smooth slurry paste consistency. Add sweet potato and toss to evenly coat. Pour into basket of air fryer (reserving medium bowl). Cook, shaking basket and spraying fries generously with cooking spray every 5 to 6 minutes, until starting to brown, about 13 minutes. Reduce air fryer temperature to 375ºF (190ºC). Continue to cook, shaking basket and spraying fries generously with cooking spray every 5 minutes, until crispy and browned, about 10 more minutes.
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
Meanwhile, clean and dry the reserved medium bowl, and set aside. Remove basket from air fryer, and pour fries into reserved bowl. Add remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, and toss evenly to coat. Pour onto a serving platter or basket, and serve immediately.
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
Special Equipment
6-quart
air fryer
Sweet Potatoes
